messages.subject: Re: any unschoolers in british columbia, canada?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Cheryl, actually, I m closer than Langley.  I m in Salmon Arm. Yeah, it IS nice to see other fairly close by unschoolers. Somehow I don t think I m going to
messages.messageBody:
Hi Cheryl, actually, I'm closer than Langley. I'm in Salmon Arm.
Yeah, it IS nice to see other fairly close by unschoolers. Somehow I
don't think I'm going to find many right here, but I'm sure going to
keep looking!

Shannon

> Cheryl
> Mom to Jaden (6) and Brenna (10 in 6 days)

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Re: any unschoolers in british columbia, canada?
messages.msgSnippet: ... That is a bit of a drive LOL!  Summerhill was/is (is it still going on?) an experimental school that was very unschoolish.  They allowed children the
messages.messageBody:
On 4/9/06, Shannon <loonsongcreations@...> wrote:
>
> Actually, I'm about 4 and a half hours from Ft. Langley. What's
> summerhillish??? I'm curious now!


That is a bit of a drive LOL! Summerhill was/is (is it still going on?) an
experimental school that was very unschoolish. They allowed children the
freedom to study what and when they wanted. Almost all of the students who
went through this school were confidant, indpendent thinkers. I don't agree
with all of the thoughts from author (there is a book titled Summerhill),
especially when it concerns sexuality and sexual identity. There are a few
other things that I believe he based his opinion on through this small
demographic.





--
Michelle
Independent Kitchen Consultant #413652
The Pampered Chef
850-474-0817
http://www.pamperedchef.biz/michellelr
Ask me how you can save 60% on some of our most favorite products!

messages.subject: Re: any unschoolers in british columbia, canada?
messages.msgSnippet: We re in Vancouver!  Most of our friends here are unschoolers too. So, if you re 4 1/2 hours from Fort Langley - are you in Kelowna? Nice to see some other
messages.messageBody:
We're in Vancouver! Most of our friends here are unschoolers too.
So, if you're 4 1/2 hours from Fort Langley - are you in Kelowna?
Nice to see some other BC'ers here!
Cheryl
Mom to Jaden (6) and Brenna (10 in 6 days)

messages.subject: Re: any unschoolers in british columbia, canada?
messages.msgSnippet: Hi-We unschool near Golden BC. Canada. We live out in the boonies and in the middle of our 5th season here (mud season) The girls had friends over and  the
messages.messageBody:
Hi-We unschool near Golden BC. Canada. We live out in the boonies and
in the middle of our 5th season here (mud season)
The girls had friends over and the washer is churning away with a
load of wet,dirty clothes-but the trampoline went up this
afternoon...the first ballon water bomb session of the year....
Our girls are almost 11.
Where are you?
I am behind a bit on messages.
grace

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] any unschoolers in british columbia, canada?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Where in BC?  BC is HUGE LOL!  If you are anywhere near Ft. Langley, let me know.  I have a very good friend who is just starting a summerhillish school
messages.messageBody:
On 4/9/06, Shannon <loonsongcreations@...> wrote:
>
>
> None.
>
> I'm in British Columbia, Canada, heart of the Rocky Mountains :)
>
> I'd love to meet some other unschoolers to see how things are done....


Where in BC? BC is HUGE LOL! If you are anywhere near Ft. Langley, let me
know. I have a very good friend who is just starting a "summerhillish"
school in Ft. Langley. I believe that Ft. Langley is fairly close to
Vancouver. My friend is an unschooler as is highlighted in one of the
unschooling books (maybe the US Handbook). She raised all three of her
daughters unschooled. So her little "unschool" will be quite unschooly!





--
Michelle

messages.subject: any unschoolers in british columbia, canada?
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for the replys on my questions about unschooling my 14 year old son who s never schooled at home. Someone asked what state I m in... None. I m in
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for the replys on my questions about unschooling my 14 year old
son who's never schooled at home.

Someone asked what state I'm in...

None.

I'm in British Columbia, Canada, heart of the Rocky Mountains :)

I'd love to meet some other unschoolers to see how things are done....
